p fan: Live in Charlotte, NC. First hot day Saturday, high 91. The heat pump fan was not running, the air handler just recirculating air. Called our service provider. They came out and could not find a problem with the unit. He just flipped circuit breaker on and off. Then about thirty minutes after communicating this to us, the tech came back and said, ‚Äúas he was putting the screws back in the heat pump it switched off again‚Äù.  Said we needed a new circuit board and would have to order. It is two days later and the unit is running fine. Are we being scammed. The cost of this repair is over $800. including the part. Our service provider provides incentives for techs with the highest sales. üôÅ

p fan: Presumably had a relay go bad on the circuit board. We bypassed the relay to have the fan run all the time until new relay could be installed. After a day the fan motor will run, but only if the system itself is set to ‚Äúoff‚Äù.  If I switch the system to ‚Äúcool‚Äù on the thermostat the fan motor shuts off (outside unit still comes on). Any ideas? Should we replace relay or proceed to replacing the whole board?
